channel.title: Comments on: On a Losing Streak… But It's Not All Bad

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Glad to hear. Definitely hope to check it out in the near future. =)
item.content:encoded: Glad to hear. Definitely hope to check it out in the near future. =)

item.title: By: Nate Eagle
item.dc:creator: Nate Eagle
item.description: Yeah, Joola's awesome. They have memberships, but for the more occasional player, $10 buys a whole day of ping pong, and the tables and space are great.
item.content:encoded: Yeah, Joola’s awesome. They have memberships, but for the more occasional player, $10 buys a whole day of ping pong, and the tables and space are great.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: I've actually only played with family here and there. Never been to a club yet. Haha. Do you recommend Joola?
item.content:encoded: I’ve actually only played with family here and there. Never been to a club yet. Haha. Do you recommend Joola?

item.title: By: Nate Eagle
item.dc:creator: Nate Eagle
item.description: Dunno! I have no vocabulary to figure out how good people are, and I've encountered dramatically different levels of ability in people I've talked to about ping pong. I know you at least know about spin, so you're not terrible, but beyond that... well, let's just say I'm curious. It'd be fun to figure out a time to play - do you have a place you like to go? I've only been to Joola.
item.content:encoded:
Dunno! I have no vocabulary to figure out how good people are, and I’ve encountered dramatically different levels of ability in people I’ve talked to about ping pong. I know you at least know about spin, so you’re not terrible, but beyond that… well, let’s just say I’m curious.
It’d be fun to figure out a time to play – do you have a place you like to go? I’ve only been to Joola.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Haha. Are you saying that just because I'm Asian? That doesn't automatically mean I'm good at ping pong you know? =P I have a feeling you could wipe the table with me. Haha. And when you do have a chance to come down to the local club, be sure to let me know! =)
item.content:encoded:
Haha. Are you saying that just because I’m Asian? That doesn’t automatically mean I’m good at ping pong you know? =P I have a feeling you could wipe the table with me. Haha.
And when you do have a chance to come down to the local club, be sure to let me know! =)

item.title: By: Nate Eagle
item.dc:creator: Nate Eagle
item.description: I don't know whether a game of ping pong with you is likely to be relaxing or not - it'd definitely be fun to find out sometime. I do wish I had the ability to go to a local club, but I just can't imagine when I would fit that in as the father of a young child. Hopefully when Axe gets older I can start taking him to play ping pong at Club Joola in Rockville.
item.content:encoded:
I don’t know whether a game of ping pong with you is likely to be relaxing or not – it’d definitely be fun to find out sometime.
I do wish I had the ability to go to a local club, but I just can’t imagine when I would fit that in as the father of a young child. Hopefully when Axe gets older I can start taking him to play ping pong at Club Joola in Rockville.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: I can completely empathize with what you're going through. It's kind of like what you said, you're probably actually progressing a lot faster; but there's something to be said about playing and growing with people of a similar rank with you so that the growth is more symbiotic and mutual. I think what you need is a relaxing game of ping pong by demolishing me in a game. =D On a slightly more serious note though, perhaps it might be good to go to a local club and play some players there. Perhaps then you will see how far you've come as a player! =)
item.content:encoded:
I can completely empathize with what you’re going through. It’s kind of like what you said, you’re probably actually progressing a lot faster; but there’s something to be said about playing and growing with people of a similar rank with you so that the growth is more symbiotic and mutual.
I think what you need is a relaxing game of ping pong by demolishing me in a game. =D On a slightly more serious note though, perhaps it might be good to go to a local club and play some players there. Perhaps then you will see how far you’ve come as a player! =)

item.title: By: Nate Eagle
item.dc:creator: Nate Eagle
item.description: I've been on a big losing streak in ping pong. At work, I mainly play with two other guys, and the past few months they've just been getting farther and farther ahead of me. I know objectively that I'm playing the best ping pong of my life, but the constant defeats are hard to take. It makes me wish I could play against some weaker opponents, just to be able to feel like I'm doing well. But why should I require the arbitrary flag of victory? Why must I resent the two guys I play against? Couldn't a reasonable mind recognize that they're probably driving me to make faster progress than I might otherwise? Couldn't a reasonable mind look at some of the shots I can hit now and take pleasure in how amazing they would have seemed to me in the past? But I do not have a reasonable mind, and I find myself weighed down by the frustration of losing.
item.content:encoded:
I’ve been on a big losing streak in ping pong. At work, I mainly play with two other guys, and the past few months they’ve just been getting farther and farther ahead of me. I know objectively that I’m playing the best ping pong of my life, but the constant defeats are hard to take. It makes me wish I could play against some weaker opponents, just to be able to feel like I’m doing well.
But why should I require the arbitrary flag of victory? Why must I resent the two guys I play against? Couldn’t a reasonable mind recognize that they’re probably driving me to make faster progress than I might otherwise? Couldn’t a reasonable mind look at some of the shots I can hit now and take pleasure in how amazing they would have seemed to me in the past?
But I do not have a reasonable mind, and I find myself weighed down by the frustration of losing.
